titleInfo.title: Oral History with former State Librarian Dr. Sam Smith regarding the history of the Highlander Folk School Papers

mods.abstract: Oral History with former State Librarian Dr. Sam Smith regarding the history of the Highlander Folk School Papers. Dr. Smith recounts his tenure as State Librarian and experience being pressured by former Governor Prentice Cooper to rid the library of Highlander's papers.

Dr. Samuel Boyd Smith was born in Adams, Tennessee. He graduated from Springfield High School, Milligan College, and received his PhD from Vanderbilt University. Dr. Smith served in the in the United States Army Air Corps for four years. After graduation from Vanderbilt he taught at the University of South Florida. Governor Frank Clement appointed Dr. Smith State Librarian in 1964 where he served for five years. Dr. Smith also served as Chairman of the Tennessee Historical Commission, editor of the Andrew Jackson Papers, and as a professor at the University of Tennessee and Tennessee State University. He died in 2003.
